report_title: Industry Report on Garage Door Installation
executive_summary: Over the past five years, garage door installation companies have benefited from increased investment in existing structures. Rising consumer confidence contributed to consumers' increased willingness to take on home improvement projects. The COVID-19 pandemic brought heavy disruption, leading to a collapse in demand for new installations and replacements. Residential demand slowed due to dropping consumer confidence, while commercial/retail demand was heavily damaged. Industry revenue has been inching upward.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Consumers are Increasingly Seeking Specialized Garage Doors
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Technological innovations have enabled installers to charge more for complex projects like internet-connected lift mechanisms that can be controlled remotely. The industry has grown at a 0.8% CAGR over the past five years and is expected to total $326.1 million in 2023. Profit will decline amid rising purchase costs.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Low Interest Rates Promoted Residential Construction
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The Federal Reserve lowered interest rates to curtail COVID-19 recession effects. Lower mortgage rates spurred home building and renovation projects which are highly sensitive to financing costs. The Fed has now raised rates to curb inflation, hampering the residential market.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Nonresidential Construction Activity Dwindles Due to Restrictions
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Nonresidential construction covers hotels, offices, stores etc. It was suspended due to COVID-19, leading to unemployment, lower consumer spending and economic decline. Recovery will be slow due to long lead times on larger nonresidential projects.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Consistent Demand for Repair Services Mitigates Volatility
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: To offset volatility from new construction, installers focus on renovations and repairs which cannot be delayed if doors are damaged. Rising corporate profits enable facility expansions/upgrades.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The economy will recover from COVID-19 and businesses will start new nonresidential projects, supporting industry growth. But rising interest rates will hamper residential construction in the short-term until rates stabilize.
Nonresidential construction like offices, hospitals and schools will recover with restored business sentiment and expanding government budgets. Remodeling projects will also provide steady work.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: New Technologies Spur Demand but Hamper Repair Work
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: New weather-resistant and eco-friendly doors have spurred installation demand but may limit repair/replacement demand long-term. But advances in computerized access systems will boost demand for trained technicians.

The growing presence of franchised operations is increasing competition for independent contractors who don't have the same marketing resources and economies of scale. Differentiation through services and new technologies will be key.

industry_definition: This industry installs garage doors and garage openers. Activities include inspection, installation, additions, alterations, maintenance and repairs.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

key_trends: Interest rates have fluctuated, impacting construction activity.
Residential construction activity boomed amid the pandemic's lows, as residential work takes a relatively short amount of time to complete and is highly susceptible to the price of financing.

Nonresidential construction activity has historically taken longer to improve post-recession. Recovery within the commercial building construction market is often slow, as it follows a lag of one to two years to that of the residential construction market.
Residential garage door installation remains the industry's largest service
Garage door installers choose to locate themselves near downstream markets
Competitive pricing is key to attracting customers in a relatively low-margin industry

market_segmentation.segment_description: The majority of garage door installation services, from new installs to repairs and maintenance, occur at residential garages. In this market, independent garage door installers advertise their services online or through other media.

Retail outlets that sell garage doors, such as Home Depot, Lowe's and other distributors, use third-party contractors to install the doors they sell. The company that sells the door pays the contractors; the customer who purchased it does not pay them. Due to this, the opportunity for miscommunication between the customer, retailer and installation operator increases, while the liability of the installation company decreases.

Utilities and manufacturing facility construction garage door installers represent a minor market for garage door installers. This segment has increased as a percentage of revenue through the end of 2023 along with the value of utilities construction.

products_and_services.product_description: Residential Garage Door Installation Services Account for the Largest Share of Industry Revenue
Commercial Garage Door Installation Suffered Amid the COVID-19 Pandemic
Maintenance and Service Work Provides High Revenue for Low Effort

tier_1_suppliers: Sheet Metal, Window & Door Manufacturing in the US
Ball Bearing Manufacturing in the US
Metal Stamping & Forging in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Tool & Hardware Wholesaling in the US
Electronic Part & Equipment Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Residential Construction Booms Amid Accommodative Interest Rates
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The majority of garage door installation services, from new installs to repairs and maintenance, occur at residential garages. Through the end of 2023 and especially amid the COVID-19 pandemic, residential construction activity increased due to highly accommodative interest rates and rising per capita disposable income.

business_locations.location: The Southeast Region, Home to Quarter of the US Population
business_locations.location_description: This region houses the most industry establishments of any region. The region includes Florida, which boasts several high-density, commercially developed cities including Miami, Orlando, Tampa and Jacksonville, among others. The frequency of adverse weather conditions in Florida results in more frequent demand for repair and installation services. Demand for repair work is more consistent compared with new construction, making Florida a key industry market.
The region includes densely populated cities in New York and New Jersey, which provide a strong source of demand for both residential and nonresidential construction.

business_locations.location: The West Benefits From A Booming Housing Market
business_locations.location_description: Dense urban populations and affluence among homeowners in these states provides an ample market for garage door upgrades, especially for higher priced and electronically connected doors. Also, space limitations in major metropolitan cities such as New York City increase the amount of parking garages and other commercial and industrial structures that require rolling overhead doors.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Most states require garage door installers to carry a contractor's license specific to this kind of work, but some installation technicians may bill themselves as handymen and lack licenses.
In some states, such as Florida, there may be regulations regarding garage door durability with regard to extreme weather.
Garage door installers are governed by laws and regulations relating to workplace safety and worker health.
Noise regulation is governed by the US Code, which is a source of federal law enacted by Congress.
In response to CDC guidance, various levels of regulation have been implemented to discourage public gathering, large events or crowded, unsafe work environments.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Garage door installing work is highly labor-intensive.
Contractors may also need specialists, such as architects and engineers, to execute specialized services, especially as technology continues to progress.

basis_points.basis_description: Competitive pricing is key to attracting customers in a relatively low-margin industry.
Garage door installers must also possess a skilled workforce to accommodate new technologies advancements.
Word-of-mouth referrals are a crucial marketing method. Garage door installers differentiate their service on the basis of price, timeliness and quality of work.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Garage door installers are localized and market specific

Garage door installation exhibits a moderate level of fragmentation due to the presence of many small, independently owned garage door installers. Also, costs can limit the geographic scope of companies.
While the largest players operate multiple locations across the United States, the industry will still include a plethora of smaller and more localized contractors.

Existing large-scale garage door installers are positioned to continue capturing high-revenue builds. Brand recognition and prior relationships play a huge role in contract acquisition and are vital to a company's success.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The bulk of expenses represent the purchase of construction tools, components and equipment. Components include springs, wiring, door bumpers and sealants, openers, lubricants, bearings and other miscellaneous hardware.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Other Costs Have Risen Due to Increased Technology Usage
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Other costs as a share of revenue have increased over the past five years.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Garage door installing work is highly labor-intensive
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Garage door installing work is highly labor-intensive. Contractors may also need specialists, such as architects and engineers, to execute specialized services, especially as technology continues to progress.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The major markets for this industry are highly concentrated
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The major markets for this industry are highly concentrated, which implies that the market has a focus on key customer segments.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Garage door installing exhibits a medium level of revenue volatility. Similar to most industries driven by the construction cycle, garage door installers are exposed to fluctuations in the real estate market.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Volatility is somewhat mitigated by repair and maintenance work
volatility_points.volatility_description: Volatility is somewhat mitigated by repair and maintenance work, which is more stable than new construction and alterations.

volatility_points.volatility_title: The COVID-19 pandemic significantly hampered the nonresidential construction market
volatility_points.volatility_description: Business activity plunged amid the COVID-19 pandemic and associated restrictions, resulting in a significant curtailment in nonresidential construction projects.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Residential garage door installation services account for the largest share of industry revenue
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: This segment includes work done for one, two and three car garages, with two car garages representing the most popular service.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Commercial garage door installation suffered amid the COVID-19 pandemic
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Businesses are less likely to replace their garage doors for cosmetic reasons relative to consumers. Commercial garage door installations generate less revenue relative to residential installations due to less frequent replacement.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Maintenance and service work provides high revenue for low effort
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The most common maintenance for manually operated doors include broken or rusty springs that inhibit the door from moving freely from an open to a closed position.

FAQs.question: Does your company primarily work with residential or non-residential construction markets?
FAQs.answer: Companies work with both markets. Companies can switch between markets depending on the type of door needing service.

FAQs.question: Does your company serve as a general contractor or third-party subcontractor on most projects?
FAQs.answer: Yes, companies serve as both general contractors and subcontractors. Subcontracting is common for large developments.

FAQs.question: How does your company compete for contracts with larger businesses?
FAQs.answer: Companies bid for contracts based on experience level and capacity.

FAQs.question: Do you ever find you lack the capacity to deliver on more-lucrative projects?
FAQs.answer: Companies may lack the capacity to meet the demand for big projects.

FAQs.question: Does your company typically rent or own equipment for projects?
FAQs.answer: Companies typically own their equipment. There is not much equipment involved with garage door installation.

FAQs.question: Does your company plan on investing in autonomous vehicles in the near future to reduce labor costs?
FAQs.answer: No. Companies do not have any use for autonomous vehicles.

FAQs.question: Has your company considered using 3D printing and other production methods that limit on-site construction work?
FAQs.answer: No. This is a service-based industry.

FAQs.question: How does your company streamline workflow when dealing with conflicting local and state regulations?
FAQs.answer: State and federal regulations are few. Due to low regulation, there are no conflicts for companies to deal with.

FAQs.question: Has complying with new energy-efficiency rules in various building codes driven up costs?
FAQs.answer: No, increased energy-efficiency rules boost demand. Companies install insulated garage doors for such purposes.

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit margins compare with your competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Profit margins depend on the size of the company. In general, margins are standard among small, localized companies.

FAQs.question: How has your company adapted to the increasing prices of key inputs over the past year?
FAQs.answer: Since this is a service industry, rising input prices hardly affect the industry. Still, increasing aluminum prices may result in decreased garage door sales.

FAQs.question: How large is your company compared to your direct competitors?
FAQs.answer: Economies of scale are achieved when businesses lower costs through expansion. Franchised installation operators exhibit lower per unit costs through the leveraging of a larger workforce and centralized administration.

FAQs.question: How do you leverage economies of scale?
FAQs.answer: Economies of scale are achieved when businesses lower costs through expansion. Franchised installation operators exhibit lower per unit costs through the leveraging of a larger workforce and centralized administration.

FAQs.question: Do you operate on a franchise model?
FAQs.answer: The largest garage door installers operate as a network of independently operated but centrally owned franchises.

FAQs.question: What services and support do you provide your franchisees?
FAQs.answer: Franchising helps lower operating costs and expand geographic reach through economies of scale.

FAQs.question: How many of your clients were referred to you by a satisfied client?
FAQs.answer: Installation crews are often the only contact a customer will have with their respective garage door dealer. Install technicians represent the face of the garage door company and help build a reputation for customer service.

FAQs.question: How difficult is it to market your company via word-of-mouth recommendations?
FAQs.answer: Installation crews are often the only contact a customer will have with their respective garage door dealer. Install technicians represent the face of the garage door company and help build a reputation for customer service.

FAQs.question: How is your establishment affected when consumer confidence is low?
FAQs.answer: Consumer sentiment reflects the confidence of consumers in the wider economy. When consumer sentiment is weak, consumers typically refrain from spending on unnecessary upgrades due to anticipated budgetary concerns.

FAQs.question: How do you generate revenue when consumer confidence is low?
FAQs.answer: Consumer sentiment reflects the confidence of consumers in the wider economy. When consumer sentiment is weak, consumers typically refrain from spending on unnecessary upgrades due to anticipated budgetary concerns.

FAQs.question: Do you track the number of housing starts in your area closely?
FAQs.answer: Industry revenue is generated from the construction of new housing, particularly from the construction of single-family homes. The number of housing starts indicates the strength of the housing sector in the near future.

FAQs.question: Do your sales figures correlate with the number of housing starts near your company?
FAQs.answer: Industry revenue is generated from the construction of new housing, particularly from the construction of single-family homes. The number of housing starts indicates the strength of the housing sector in the near future.

FAQs.question: What proportion of your demand is linked to home improvements?
FAQs.answer: A significant share of industry revenue is generated from garage door installation on existing homes.

FAQs.question: How can you expand further into the residential construction market?
FAQs.answer: Fluctuations in the value of investment into this market influence the pace of industry expansion.
